content.question: Which of the following does the author use to support her argument that the pattern of the Commercial Revolution in England and the Netherlands represented an exceptional case rather than a pattern characteristic of Europe in general?

choices.label: The institutional restraints guilds placed on economic activity in those countries.
The strong role of national churches in the economic activities of England and the Netherlands.
The role of community norms in enforcing restrictions on economic activities in those countries.
The transition of women into market jobs, which increased purchases of consumer goods in England and the Netherlands.

content.answer: The transition of women into market jobs, which increased purchases of consumer goods in England and the Netherlands.

skill.text: Skill 3.B: Identify the evidence used in a source to support an argument.
